comments: For n >= 0 let A(n) the product of the positive integers <= n that have the same parity as n minus the product of the positive integers <= n that have the opposite parity as n. Then a(n) = A(n-1) (for n>=3). [Peter Luschny, Jul 06 2011]
references: S. P. Hurd and J. S. McCranie, Quantum factorials. Proceedings of the Twenty-fifth Southeastern International Conference on Combinatorics, Graph Theory and Computing (Boca Raton, FL, 1994). Congr. Numer. 104 (1994), 19-24.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=3..100
maple: P:=proc(n) local i,j,k,w; for i from 1 by 1 to n do k:=i; w:=i-2; while w>0 do k:=k*w; w:=w-2; od; j:=i+1; w:=i-1; while w>0 do j:=j*w; w:=w-2; od; print(j-k); od; end: P(100); - _Paolo P. Lava_, Jun 14 2007DDF := proc(n) local R, P, k; R := {$1..n}; P := select(k->k mod 2 = n mod 2, R); mul(k, k = P) - mul(k, k = R minus P) end: A007911 := n -> DDF(n-1); # [Peter Luschny, Jul 06 2011]
author: _J. H. Conway_
